31.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
31.str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

32.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
32.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Apparently a primary word; an 'hour'.

32.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
32.str2: To come, go.
And, even, also, namely.

32.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
32.str2: To come, go.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

32.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Plural
32.str2: Apparently from the same as skorpios; to dissipate, i.e. put to flight, waste, be liberal.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.

32.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
32.str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

32.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
32.str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
And, even, also, namely.

32.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
32.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

32.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

32.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
32.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

33.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
33.str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

33.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
33.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

33.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
33.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

33.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
33.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).

33.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

33.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
33.str2: To be of good courage, good cheer, be bold. From tharsos; to have courage.

33.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

33.str2: To conquer, be victorious, overcome, prevail, subdue. From nike; to subdue.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
